reviewText: When I saw the star-studded lineup, I thought "this could be kind of cool".Have to agree with those comparing it to a stage play.  Some of the performances are either maudlin or overacted.  And Idi Amin in a pink jacket and a Huggy Bear feathered hat?  Really?  Really?Interesting seeing a youngish Anthony Hopkins playing in cabinet against a youngish Burt Lancaster, and a youngish Richard Dreyfuss as Yoni Nethanayu.I was torn between 2 and 3 stars - I nudged toward 3 only because it bears watching as a historical lesson about what star-studded TV was like in the day.
summary: I was spoiled watching "Operation Thunderbolt" first
Title: N/A

reviewText: Well-acted, fascinating account of an actual event.  It focuses more on the hostages and their hijackers than the movie Raid On Entebbe.  Raid On Entebbe focused more on the military and political aspects.  Both movies combine to give a well-rounded account of this event.
summary: FASCINATING ACCOUNT OF AN ACTUAL RESCUE
Title: N/A

reviewText: I wanted to see this movie because it is a true story about Colonel Yonatan Netanyahu who was the brother of today's Prime Minister of Isreal.I have heard that this movie was shot using video tape, so don't expect great quality. It feels somewhat like watching a soap opera.However, this is a good story and if you want to see some great actors such as Elizabeth Taylor, Anthony Hopkins, Linda Blair, Helen Hayes, Burt Lancaster, Richard Dreyfuss, and Kirk Douglas all in one cast then it's worth checking out.
Title: N/A
